pr_title: Issue 4792: API stubs for supporting offset/version based TableSegment reads.

timeline.message:
Initial API proposal on offset based TableSegment reads.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

Add basic unit tests for new WireCommands.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

timeline.bodyText: Maybe make these two different so we also check that order is preserved.
timeline.author: tkaitchuck

timeline.bodyText: we should read this value only if it available.Else the OLDEST_COMPATIBLE_VERSION will change.
timeline.author: shrids

replies.bodyText: Correct. Check out for other examples in this file; there should be a few that followed the same pattern.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

replies.bodyText: And if not provided, then set it to that negative value I mentioned in the comment above.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.author: shrids

timeline.bodyText:
Default this to something negative such as -1 or Long.MIN_VALUE. The contract will be that if we are provided a negative value, the update will be unconditioned (on the length of the segment). Otherwise (0 included), we'll condition the update on the table segment having the specified length.
I would further suggest encoding this as a public constant in the wire command itself.
timeline.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.bodyText:
Have this throw UnsupportedOperationException and add a comment that it will be implemented with
#4677
timeline.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.message:
Add checks if a tableSegmentOffset was provided.
Creates a constant value signifying no offset was provided.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>
